item.description:
What's happening is this:
Each Wednesday the city sponsors a concert on the lower green, and local organic farmers trot out their produce in front of city hall. The music can be heard while browsing berries, lettuce, etc.

The Market is open 11a-4p.

Music starts at noon and continues until 2p. I'll be there at NOON and will carry
a purple frisbee, at least one wooden director's chair with
green fabric.

The town provides some seats and tables. I'll try to bring a
little more seating in case. The music talent is usually
tight, professional, and good sounding. The stage is on the
lower green, tunes are beamed towards the mayor's office from
about 75 yards away. Below Destefano's office the organic
vendors operate their stands. Makes for a nice scene, with
rampant jaywalking across Church street.

I got a lettuce mix last time that I couldn't stop eating. I
think this may point up some inadequacies in my diet.

It's good to support the farmer's and good to give the
musicians a crowd to play to. The first week this year, on
7/11, attendance was light, but the band was very solid.

Blues, Berries & Jam is what they call this Wednesday
concert/farmer's market.

So come along and bring friends if you like.

Cheers,
Rob
item.name: City Farmers' Market, 12-2p concert, Lower New Haven Green
